name: Orion
description: Orion is a prominent constellation located on the celestial equator and visible throughout the world. It is one of the most conspicuous and recognizable constellations in the night sky.

name: Canis Major
description: Canis Major is a constellation in the southern celestial hemisphere. In the second century, it was included in Ptolemy's 48 constellations, and is counted among the 88 modern constellations.

name: Canis Minor
description: Canis Minor is a small constellation in the northern celestial hemisphere. In the second century, it was included as an asterism, or pattern, of two stars in Ptolemy's 48 constellations.

name: Ursa Major
description: Ursa Major is a constellation in the northern sky, whose associated mythology likely dates back into prehistory. Its Latin name means greater bear, contrasting it with nearby Ursa Minor, the lesser bear.

name: Cassiopeia
description: Cassiopeia is a constellation in the northern sky named after the vain queen Cassiopeia, mother of Andromeda, in Greek mythology, who boasted about her unrivaled beauty.

name: Taurus
description: Taurus is one of the constellations of the zodiac and is located in the northern celestial hemisphere. Taurus is a large and prominent constellation in the Northern Hemisphere's winter sky.
